data.title: Melissa Snover on LinkedIn: People: Tech Nation; Muse; Stephen Alexander
data.meta_description: I was recently interviewed by TheBusinessDesk.com, where my roles as an advisor at Tech Nation and a commissioner at the Greater Birmingham Chambers of…
data.text:
How North East tech businesses develop new products and processes, then bring them to commercial fruition, was the main topic of discussion at a recent Insider Media North East Roundtable. We heard from a group of tech business leaders who are making huge strides in this hugely competitive and fast-moving sector. We also learned how they were managing the funding landscape, how they dealt with IP issues, and some of the opportunities they were exploiting that will see them grow in 2024 and beyond. What is clear is that there is a highly motivated, supremely skilled and expert eco-system of tech businesses in the North East that is making the region a hub for collaboration and creative excellence, one which is fast gaining commercial clout and permeating way beyond the boundaries of the North East. A report of the Roundtable can be read in the link below. The Roundtable was sponsored by Invest Newcastle Maven Capital Partners Ryecroft Glenton and Square One Law and was held at The North East Technology Park - NETPark - which is home to a number of superb tech businesses - in the ORBIT Innovation Space of Durham University. Thanks to all who took part for making excellent contributions to this stimulating and thought-provoking event. Michael Stirrup Simon Newton Fozia Saleem Joanne Rout Michael Tyerman Pete Watson – Atlas Cloud Harry Armstrong Raviteja Burugu Dawn Dunn Rebecca MacDermid Carl Swansbury FCA Helen Brain Thomas Allport Photos by Mark Pinder https://lnkd.in/eyJpPXrE

Birmingham is known as the UK’s second city for good reason. Not only is it the second largest metro area in the UK, it’s also the number one regional tech cluster: more than 65,000 people are employed in tech roles at 12,500 businesses. In fact, more software developers, programmers and software architects are based in Birmingham than anywhere else in the nation. Birmingham is also home to corporate giants such as Jaguar, Cadbury and Unliver, yet 89% of the companies in the region are micro-businesses with fewer than ten employees. In 2023, Birmingham startups raised $1.7 billion in capital, after raising $190 million in 2022 and $420 million in 2021. Here’s a look at six of the hottest tech companies in the region: https://lnkd.in/ga9-EqHs Companies featured (in no particular order): Orlo | Grid Edge | 3DVieweronline | Graide | Dynamic Mobile Billing and Conigital Group

High-growth companies: what do you need to unleash your full potential? Are you at the helm of a high-growth business with ambitions that outpace your current scale? If so, we invite you to participate in a focus session to explore the unique barriers you face. Date: 7 March 2024 Time: 10am to 12pm Venue: Basingstoke and Deane Borough Council Offices. See address and parking info on Finding us (basingstoke.gov.uk) Data shows that our area has a high density of companies with scale-up potential, but that they aren’t growing as fast as similar businesses in other areas of the country. We want to explore what it is that is needed to unblock these barriers and support you on your scale-up journey. This interactive session is convened by a consortium of key local stakeholders*, including local government, industry experts, and funding bodies. Our shared objective is to: ✅Identify and dissect the specific challenges faced by scale-up businesses navigating rapid growth. ✅Foster a supportive network to accelerate your growth trajectory and maximize your positive impact on our region. Your participation holds immense value for both your business and the broader community: ✅ Become a driving force for regional prosperity: Scale-up businesses are the engines of economic dynamism, creating jobs, fostering innovation, and revitalising our economic landscape. ✅Shape the future of the local ecosystem: Your contributions directly inform initiatives designed to create a fertile environment for scale-up success. This exclusive session is ideal for: ✅Established businesses on a rapid growth trajectory. ✅Companies with potential for significant economic impact. ✅Leaders facing challenges in areas like talent acquisition, funding, marketing, or operational optimisation. Seats are limited but a virtual alternative is available. Please contact beata.ronchi@enterprisem3.org.uk to reserve your place or request a meeting link. Together, let's unlock the transformative power of scale-ups and build a thriving, dynamic future for our people and place. *EM3 LEP, British Business Bank, Innovate UK EDGE, Hampshire Chamber of Commerce, Hampshire County Council, Basingstoke and Deane Borough Council, Rushmoor Borough Council, The ScaleUp Institute, IncuHive, FSE

Big announcement today! Cityfi is going global with our expansion to Europe. This is the next evolution for our firm, and commitment to collaboratively shape visionary futures. Linking our unique blend of business advisory, subject matter expertise, civic innovation, and public affairs across the U.S. and Europe to accelerate growth and impact for clients. I'm excited for Evan Corey Costagliola as he heads to the Netherlands to lead our new office. A great partner that is entrepreneurial, focused on outcomes, a strategic thinker, creative, and driven to build partnerships. Please reach out to learn more about our vision that will connect the U.S. and Europe in a forward-thinking way, and how we can collaborate! https://lnkd.in/e5FDtXud #global #Europe #netherlands #innovation #civicinnovation #government #publicpolicy #publicaffairs #startups #entrepreneurship #growth #mobility #transportation #climate #cleantech #technology #ai #cities #fintech #eu #venturecapital #venture

For EdTech entrepreneurs: an interesting session at the London Tech Week Fireside Chat: Educating Opportunities in STEM for the Future of Entrepreneurship Tuesday 11 June 2024 15:10 - 15:30 Founders Stage Join us as we sit down with a seasoned entrepreneur who has navigated the highs and lows of building a startup from the ground up. Deep diving into personal experiences, this discussion will spotlight how setbacks can be reframed as invaluable learning opportunities, catalysts for innovation, and drivers of resilience. Discover actionable strategies, mindset shifts, and practical insights to harness adversity as fuel for growth, propelling your entrepreneurial journey forward. Whether you're facing challenges or seeking to fortify your startup's resilience, this fireside chat promises to inspire, motivate, and equip you with the tools to turn setbacks into stepping stones toward success. https://lnkd.in/dZ54hdH
